title: Bug 49299: Servlet 3.0 chapter 7.1.1 discrepancy with custom cookie name and URL rewriting
description: Bug 49299: In chapter 7.1.1 of servlet30finalspec.pdf, it is stated that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name will also be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session id is encoded in the URL (when URL rewriting is enabled). However, the observed behavior does not match the expected behavior.
OB:
The page sends the following cookie:
SetCookie: MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F; Path=/cookiename; HttpOnly
But the Reload link on the page uses 'jsessionid':
http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;jsessionid=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F4.
EB:
I expected the Reload link to be:
http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Deploy the attached 'cookiename.war' file.
2. Enable URL rewriting in the web application.
3. Visit the index.jsp page of the deployed application.
4. Look at the cookie sent by the page.
5. Click on the Reload link and observe the URL parameters used.
